title: Diagram Generator
original_prompt: I want you to act as a Graphviz DOT generator, an expert to create meaningful diagrams. The diagram should have at least n nodes (I specify n in my input by writting [n], 10 being the default value) and to be an accurate and complexe representation of the given input. Each node is indexed by a number to reduce the size of the output, should not include any styling, and with layout=neato, overlap=false, node [shape=rectangle] as parameters. The code should be valid, bugless and returned on a single line, without any explanation. Provide a clear and organized diagram, the relationships between the nodes have to make sense for an expert of that input. My first diagram is:
input1: "A project management workflow with [n] nodes representing stages: 1. Initiation, 2. Planning, 3. Execution, 4. Monitoring, 5. Closing, 6. Stakeholder Engagement, 7. Risk Management, 8. Resource Allocation, 9. Quality Assurance, 10. Lessons Learned."
input2: "A social media network with [n] nodes representing users and their interactions: 1. User A, 2. User B, 3. User C, 4. User D, 5. User E, 6. User F, 7. User G, 8. User H, 9. User I, 10. User J, with relationships like follows, likes, and comments."
input1_ans: digraph G { layout=neato; overlap=false; node [shape=rectangle]; 1 [label="Initiation"]; 2 [label="Planning"]; 3 [label="Execution"]; 4 [label="Monitoring"]; 5 [label="Closing"]; 6 [label="Stakeholder Engagement"]; 7 [label="Risk Management"]; 8 [label="Resource Allocation"]; 9 [label="Quality Assurance"]; 10 [label="Lessons Learned"]; 1 -> 2; 2 -> 3; 3 -> 4; 4 -> 5; 1 -> 6; 2 -> 7; 3 -> 8; 4 -> 9; 5 -> 10; 6 -> 7; 7 -> 8; 8 -> 9; 9 -> 10; }
input2_ans: digraph G { layout=neato; overlap=false; node [shape=rectangle]; 1 [label="User A"]; 2 [label="User B"]; 3 [label="User C"]; 4 [label="User D"]; 5 [label="User E"]; 6 [label="User F"]; 7 [label="User G"]; 8 [label="User H"]; 9 [label="User I"]; 10 [label="User J"]; 1 -> 2 [label="follows"]; 1 -> 3 [label="likes"]; 2 -> 4 [label="comments"]; 3 -> 5 [label="follows"]; 4 -> 6 [label="likes"]; 5 -> 7 [label="comments"]; 6 -> 8 [label="follows"]; 7 -> 9 [label="likes"]; 8 -> 10 [label="comments"]; 9 -> 1 [label="follows"]; 10 -> 2 [label="likes"]; }
